title: Sampler, 1783
medium:
Medium: silk, linen, and cotton embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; withdrawn element work; cutwork filled with hollie point; herringbone, chain, buttonhole and satin stitches on plain weave foundation, quilled ribbo
provenance: Ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description: A basket of large flowers, with the flowers executed in drawn work, cut work, and hollie point in white embroidery on a white ground. The basket trimmings, stems of flowers, and isolated sprigs of flowers at bottom are worked in colored silks. With the inscription: Mary Babb 1783.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1783.
1783. Medium: silk, linen, and cotton embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; withdrawn element work; cutwork filled with hollie point; herringbone, chain, buttonhole and satin stitches on plain weave foundation, quilled ribbo. Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe. 1974-42-12.
